channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large hole you filled a few months ago waste of time, 15th February
Another large pot hole please do something about the pot holes in this road, 15th February

item.description:
Only the pole is in place, no sign attached. The pole also isn't standing straight

item.title: Blocked up drain at the end of Townsend street, Cheltenham., 15th February
item.description:
At the end of Townsend street, on the left hand side of the road, the drain is blocked creating a big puddle.

item.title: Footpath sign totally missing, 15th February
item.description:
Looks like it was removed during recent land redevelopment as area seems to be used for storage of theme park rides. A footpath sign definitely used to be here in the past

item.title: Drain blocked on Hatherley Court Road, 15th February
item.description:
North side of road between numbers 20 and 21. Attempted to clear drain rodding with stick but despite bubbles did not clear. Flooding covers 1/2 the road now during rain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Hatherley Court Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Two newly planted trees have been snapped, 15th February
item.description:
Close to the fire station, just off the footpath heading to Milliner Crescent. Specific location: 51.88075325056154, -2.198412855097366

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Drain is now completely blocked outside 25/27 Alexandra Street, 15th February
item.description:
The gunk that is stuck in this drain was first reported around 18 months ago. Now it has utterly filled the drain so that the grate can hardly be seen. With the amount of rain, recently, and the fact it is almost the only drain on that side of the road, means that rainwater is gushing along the gutters.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Alexandra Street, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Massive pothole punctured my tyre and damaged my wheel rim, 15th February
item.description:
On Leckhampton hill. Another report has referenced same pothole and have reported to emergency/urgent out of hours line but issuing here for completeness and reference no. I will be claiming and would like a claim form to be sent to me. This is second pothole on Leckhampton hill to puncture my tyres in past two months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole in the road, near pedestrian refuge, 15th February
item.description:
What3Words: dinner.chat.slurs On the left side of the road, heading in the direction towards the main roundabout. Please note there is also another pothole very close to this one, closer to the pedestrian refuge.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finlay Way, Bishop's Cleeve

item.category: Bollard cover is off but not causing a trip hazard/obstruction

item.title: Numerous large and deep potholes along the whole length of Whittington Road, 15th February
item.description:
This series of potholes is spread along the whole length of Whittington Road, some appear to have had some tarmac thrown in them at some point The condition is absolutely disgraceful and represents the surface more likely to found in some third world country. Come on Highways department get this new "super pothole repairer" out here and put it to some good use!!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 45cm wide pothole. More than ankle deep., 15th February
item.description:
As you turn into the Yarnolds, about a third of the way down, there are several deep potholes that cannot be avoided. With the park cars at the side of the road you are unable to go around it. The pothole is hard to see as filled with dirty rain water. I drove over it and cut my tyre open. I had to have a new tyre fitted. My existing tyre on the car was less than 6 months old. It cost me £75 for a new tyre and I would like to be reimbursed please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Yarnolds, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
